body:

subject: OKC Summer Camp - Week 2, 4th-7th Grade
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families,

Thank you for choosing to join us for Summer Camp this year! We are looking
forward to having a great time!

Please be aware that we will be practicing some new policies and procedures
this summer, including:

*OKC Summer Camp will not be open Friday, July 3rd.*

*Drop Off / Pick up*
All children need to check in outside the front door for a health
screening. Then you can drop off your child at the exterior door of their
classroom. We are Door #2, conveniently the closest to the front door! When
picking up your child, please check in at the front door and staff will
radio to your child's room to let them exit Door #2.

*Items from home*
Please send:

   - Sunscreen (Spray or face stick preferably so your child can apply
   theirself).
   - Bug Spray.
   - Extra clothes to keep in their bag.
   - Bathing suit & towel on water play days (Tues & Thurs)
   - Hat (we will be outside often)
   - Water Bottle
   - *COLD lunch (Microwaves will not be available for use by children or
   staff). We will not be able to make any exceptions.*

*** Children will not be able to bring items from home for play (toys,
devices, etc.) We will not be able to make any exceptions.*

Daily Schedule

*Sports Week*
7:00-9:00       Sign in / Free choice
9:00-9:30       Snack
9:30-11:00     Monday - Make Your Own Sidewalk Chalk
                      Tuesday - Disc Golf
`                    Wednesday - Croquet
                      Thursday - Ultimate Frisbee
                      Friday - 3k Walk

11:45-12:15   Gym

1:30-2:45       Free choice
                     Life Size Sorry (Wednesday)
2:45-3:30      Gym
3:30-4:00      Snack
4:00-5:00      Free choice
5:00-5:45      Outside
5:30-6:00      D.E.A.R.


*OKC Summer Camp will not be open Friday, July 3rd.*

*The Staff!*

Mr. Brussow
[image: IMG_20200619_132634_01.jpg][image: IMG_20200619_132802_01.jpg]
Ms. Kelsie


Adam Brussow

subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 8
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families!

Our theme this week is *Adventure* and the *Wednesday field trip* is to the
East Lansing Aquatic Center from *10:30 to 3:00*. Our Thursday afternoon
activity will be Camping Games! So, please send swimwear, water shoes, and
a towel Wednesday, AND Friday.

*East Lansing Aquatic Center Reminders*

   - If your child has any swimming or water slide restrictions, please let
   Mr. Brussow know before the field trip.
   - Please send a sack lunch. We will be eating lunch at the Aquatic
   Center and we can throw away all our trash from lunch and not worry about
   leaving a lunch box behind!
   - Sunscreen will go with each class so we can reapply after lunch.
   - Don't forget to send a towel!


*Drop Off / Pick up*

   - Sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up using the time and
   initials.
   - You may enter through door #1, go to the classroom (Room 107) to be
   let in the classroom.
   - Door #1 will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. From 9:00-4:00,
   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.
   - Please have a *photo ID* with you at pick up.


*Please send:*
Sunscreen.
Bug Spray.
Extra clothes.
Water Bottle.
Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on water play (Friday) and swimming
days.
Hat (we will be outside often).
Cold lunch from home *each day*. Microwave ovens will not be available for
children to use.

*Adventure Schedule*

9:30-10:30   Snack & Outside
10:30-11:30 Monday - DIY Salsa
                    Tuesday - Geocaching
                    Wednesday - Free Choice
                    Thursday - Escape Room Setup
                    Friday - Escape Room Challenge
11:30-12:00 Free choice (Gym T/Th)
12:00-12:30 Lunch
12:30-1:00   Literacy Time
                    Apply Sunscreen/Bug Spray
1:00-3:00    Monday - Nature Walk
                   Tuesday - Outdoor Activities and Games
                   Wednesday - East Lansing Aquatic Center *(10:30 - 3:00)*
                   Thursday - Camping Games (2:00 - 3:00)
                   Friday - Water Play (2:30 - 3:15)
3:00-4:00    Snack & Outside
4:00-5:30    Free choice
5:30-6:00    Quiet Free Choice

*Staff*
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)
Ms. Maren (Program Assistant)

subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 4
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families!

Our theme this week is Around the World and the *Wednesday field trip* is
to Patriarche Park in East Lansing from *12:30 to 3:00*.

*OKC will be closed Monday, July 4th for the Holiday.*

*Foods Around the World*
For our Thursday Activity this week, we are asking families and staff to
bring in foods from different cultures! We will set up all the foods in the
commons area and allow kids and staff to have a taste of the different
foods. We are looking for a mix of savory, snack, and dessert foods!

We will need a complete ingredient list for the foods brought in for
allergy reasons.


*Drop Off / Pick up*

   - Sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up using the time and
   initials.
   - You may enter through door #1, go to the classroom (Room 107) to be
   let in the classroom.
   - Door #1 will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. From 9:00-4:00,
   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.
   - Please have a *photo ID* with you at pick up.


*Please send:*
Sunscreen.
Bug Spray.
Extra clothes.
Water Bottle.
Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on water play (Friday) and swimming
days.
Hat (we will be outside often).
Cold lunch from home *each day*. Microwave ovens will not be available for
children to use.

*Junkyard Wars*
One of our Thursday activities this year for summer camp will be "junkyard
wars" (taking place on July 21st). The kids will be creating
unique/creative structures out of recycled materials and looking for
donations. We'll take just about anything with which the kids can use
safely to build.
Some examples are:
(no glass or aluminum cans)
boxes
paper towel/toilet paper rolls
tissue boxes
other cardboard items
plastic containers (that have been cleaned)
foam
milk jugs
bubble wrap

*Around the World Week Schedule*
7:15-9:00     Sign in / Free choice
9:00-10:00   Snack & Outside
10:00-11:00 Tuesday - Drinking Straw Rollercoasters
                    Wednesday - Free Choice
                    Thursday - African Thumb Pianos
                    Friday - DIY Constellation Projectors
11:00-12:00 Free choice (Gym 11:30 T/Th)
12:00-12:30 Lunch
12:30-1:00   Literacy Time
                    Apply Sunscreen/Bug Spray
1:00-3:00    Tuesday - Outdoor Physical Activities/Games
                   Wednesday - Patriarche Park *(12:30 - 3:30)*
                   Thursday - *Foods Around The World**
                   Friday - Water Play (2:30 - 3:15)
3:00-4:00    Snack & Outside
4:00-5:30    Free choice
5:30-6:00    Quiet Free Choice

*Staff*
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)
Ms. Maren (Program Assistant)

*Reminders:*

   - If a child needs prescription medication, parents and doctors must
   sign a district form and provide that form with the medication.
   - Wednesday is a Field Trip day which means your camper NEEDS to wear
   their field trip shirt. They will receive a shirt the second week of camp.
   (Or their first week).
   - All personal belongings should be labeled with your child's name. Kids
   should be careful about what they choose to bring to camp. OKC staff will

Thank you!

subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 4
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families!

We are thrilled to announce that the theme for this week is the magical
world of Storybooks! We have planned an array of enchanting activities that
will take our campers through the pages of their favorite tales.

Please note that Okemos Kids Club will be closed on Tuesday, July 4th, in
observance of Independence Day.

Our week-long morning activity, "Kingdom Creations: A Fairy Tale Castle
Construction!", a super fun, multi-day activity where we'll work together
to design, build, and decorate our very own fairy tale castle using
cardboard, Plaster of Paris, paint, and all sorts of cool decorations.

On Monday, we will be making a splash at Lake Lansing South from 12:30 to
3:30. Please pack swimwear, water shoes, and a towel.

We are set for an adventurous Wednesday field trip to Hawk Island from
12:15 to 3:45 for another swimming afternoon!

On Thursday afternoon, our campers will engage their artistic sides with
Storybook Tiles from Art Unlimited.

We have also planned a delightful Friday afternoon with water play or a
nature walk. Don’t forget the swimwear!

Drop Off / Pick Up
Please sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up, using the time and
initials. Our entrance is through door #9 leading to Room 109. This door
will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. For any visits between
9:00-4:00, you will need to be buzzed in. We kindly request a photo ID at
pick up for safety purposes.

Please ensure your child brings the following each day:

Sunscreen
Bug Spray
Extra clothes
Water Bottle
Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on swimming days (Monday & Wednesday)
and water play day (Friday)
Hat (since we'll be outdoors frequently)
Cold lunch (microwaves are unavailable)

Here's a glance at our Storybook Week Daily Schedule:
7:15-9:00 Sign in / Free choice
9:00-10:00 Snack & Outside Time
10:00-11:00 Kingdom Creations: A Fairy Tale Castle Construction!
11:00-12:00 Free choice (Gym 11:30 M/Th)
12:00-12:30 Lunch
12:30-1:00 Literacy Time / Apply Sunscreen/Bug Spray
1:00-3:00 Monday - Lake Lansing South (12:30 - 3:30)
                Wednesday - Hawk Island (12:15 - 3:45)
                Friday - Water Play or Nature Walk
3:00-4:00 Snack & Outside Time
4:00-5:30 Free choice
5:30-6:00 Quiet Free Choice

Staff
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Ms. Kaci (Program Assistant)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)
Ms. Kayden (Program Assistant)

Reminders:

Campers may bring phones or devices for texting parents if necessary, but
please refrain from gaming or watching videos.
If your child requires prescription medication, kindly provide us with the
signed district form from both you and your doctor, accompanied by the
medication.
For field trips, campers need to wear their field trip shirts. They will
receive this in their second week of camp (or their first week).
We advise all personal belongings to be clearly labeled. The OKC staff
can't be responsible for any lost or misplaced personal items.
We're looking forward to a week full of enchanting storybook adventures.
Thank you for entrusting your children to us!

Best Regards,

Adam Brussow
Director, Club Kinawa
Okemos Public Schools
517-706-4715

subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 1
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families,

Thank you for choosing to join us for Summer Camp this year! We are looking
forward to having a great time!

Here is some information for you regarding Summer Camp and this week's
schedule. Our theme this week is Community Service.

*Drop Off / Pick up*

   - Sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up using the time and
   initials.
   - You may enter through door #9, go to the classroom (Room 109) to be
   let in the classroom.
   - Door #9 will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. From 9:00-4:00,
   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.
   - Please have a *photo ID* with you at pick up.


*Please send:*
Sunscreen.
Bug Spray.
Extra clothes.
Water Bottle.
Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on water play (Friday) and swimming
days.
Hat (we will be outside often).
Cold lunch from home *each day*. Microwave ovens will not be available for
children to use.

*Junkyard Wars*
One of our Thursday activities this year for summer camp will be "junkyard
wars" (taking place August 3rd). The kids will be creating unique/creative
structures out of recycled materials and looking for donations. We'll take
just about anything with which the kids can use safely to build.
Some examples are:
boxes
paper towel/toilet paper rolls
tissue boxes
other cardboard items
plastic containers (that have been cleaned)
milk jugs
bubble wrap
(no glass or aluminum cans, no white styrofoam)

*Community Service Week Schedule*
7:15-9:00     Sign in / Free choice
9:00-10:00   Snack & Outside
10:00-11:00 Wednesday - "Snowball" Fight - 2 Truths:1 Lie / Free Choice
                    Thursday - Exploratories - Inspirational Sidewalk Quote
Art
                    Friday - Exploratories - Fluffy Slime

12:00-12:30 Lunch

                    Apply Sunscreen/Bug Spray

                   Thursday - Cleaning up around Edgewood
                   Friday - Water Play (2:30 - 3:15) or Nature Walk
3:00-4:00    Snack & Outside
4:00-5:30    Free choice
5:30-6:00    Quiet Free Choice

*Staff*
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Ms. Kaci (Program Assistant)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)

*Reminders:*

   - If a child needs prescription medication, parents and doctors must
   sign a district form and provide that form with the medication.
   - Wednesday is a Field Trip day which means your camper NEEDS to wear
   their field trip shirt. They will receive a shirt the second week of camp.

subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 7
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families!

Our theme this week is *Outer Space* and the *Wednesday field trip* is to
Fitzgerald Park from *12:30 to 4:30*. Our Thursday afternoon activity will
be Making Rockets!

*Drop Off / Pick up*

   - Sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up using the time and
   initials.
   - You may enter through door #1, go to the classroom (Room 107) to be
   let in the classroom.
   - Door #1 will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. From 9:00-4:00,
   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.
   - Please have a *photo ID* with you at pick up.


*Please send:*
Sunscreen.
Bug Spray.
Extra clothes.
Water Bottle.
Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on water play (Friday) and swimming
days (Wednesday).
Hat (we will be outside often).
Cold lunch from home *each day*. Microwave ovens will not be available for
children to use.

*Outer Space Schedule*
7:15-9:00     Sign in / Free choice
9:00-10:00   Snack & Outside
10:00-11:00 Monday - Watermelon Pizza
                    Tuesday - Erupting Moon Dust
                    Wednesday - Free Choice
                    Thursday - NASA Moon Survival Challenge
                    Friday - Free Choice
11:00-12:00 Free choice (Gym 11:30 T/Th)
12:00-12:30 Lunch
12:30-1:00   Literacy Time
                    Apply Sunscreen/Bug Spray
1:00-3:00    Monday - Nature Walk
                   Tuesday - Outdoor Activities and Games
                   Wednesday - Lake Lansing South *(12:30 - 4:30)*
                   Thursday - Making Rockets
                   Friday - Water Play (2:30 - 3:15)
3:00-4:00    Snack & Outside
4:00-5:30    Free choice
5:30-6:00    Quiet Free Choice

*Staff*
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)
Ms. Maren (Program Assistant)

*Reminders:*

   - If a child needs prescription medication, parents and doctors must
   sign a district form and provide that form with the medication.
   - Wednesday is a Field Trip day which means your camper NEEDS to wear
   their field trip shirt. They will receive a shirt the second week of camp.
   (Or their first week).
   - All personal belongings should be labeled with your child's name. Kids
   should be careful about what they choose to bring to camp. OKC staff will
   not be able to be responsible for any personal items.

Thank you!


Adam Brussow
Director, Club Kinawa
Okemos Public Schools
517-706-5231

subject: 4th-7th Grade Camp Week 6 Newsletter
body:
Hello OKC Families,

Attached is the 4th-7th grade newsletter for week 6 of Summer Camp.

If you have any questions or concerns, please let me know.

Thank you!

Adam Brussow
Director, Club Kinawa
Okemos Public Schools
517-706-5233

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Adam Brussow <>
Date: Fri, Jun 17, 2022 at 3:13 PM
Subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 2
To: Adam Brussow <>


Hello Okemos Kids Club Families!

Our theme this week is the Rainforest and the *Wednesday field trip* is to
Hawk Island Lake from *12:15 to 3:45*.

*Drop Off / Pick up*

   - Sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up using the time and
   initials.
   - You may enter through door #1, go to the classroom (Room 107) to be
   let in the classroom.
   - Door #1 will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. From 9:00-4:00,
   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.
   - Please have a *photo ID* with you at pick up.


*Please send:*
Sunscreen.
Bug Spray.
Extra clothes.
Water Bottle.
Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on water play (Friday) and swimming
days.
Hat (we will be outside often).
Cold lunch from home *each day*. Microwave ovens will not be available for
children to use.

*Junkyard Wars*
One of our Thursday activities this year for summer camp will be "junkyard
wars" (taking place on July 21st). The kids will be creating
unique/creative structures out of recycled materials and looking for
donations. We'll take just about anything with which the kids can use
safely to build.
Some examples are:
(no glass or aluminum cans)
boxes
paper towel/toilet paper rolls
tissue boxes
other cardboard items
plastic containers (that have been cleaned)
foam
milk jugs
bubble wrap

*Rainforest Week Schedule*
7:15-9:00     Sign in / Free choice
9:00-10:00   Snack & Outside
10:00-11:00 Monday - Mentos Geysers
                    Tuesday - Papercraft Optical Illusions
                    Wednesday - Free Choice
                    Thursday - DIY Kaleidoscopes
                    Friday - Exploratories
11:00-12:00 Free choice (Gym 11:30 T/Th)
12:00-12:30 Lunch
12:30-1:00   Literacy Time
                    Apply Sunscreen/Bug Spray
1:00-3:00    Monday - Nature/Neighborhood Walk
                   Tuesday - Planned Outdoor Physical Activities
                   Wednesday - Hawk Island Lake *(12:15 - 3:45)*
                   Thursday - Lifesize Board Games
                   Friday - Water Play (2:30 - 3:15)
3:00-4:00    Snack & Outside
4:00-5:30    Free choice
5:30-6:00    Quiet Free Choice

*Staff*
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)
Ms. Maren (Program Assistant)

*Reminders:*

   - If a child needs prescription medication, parents and doctors must
   sign a district form and provide that form with the medication.
   - Wednesday is a Field Trip day which means your camper NEEDS to wear
   their field trip shirt. They will receive a shirt the second week of camp.
   (Or their first week).
   - All personal belongings should be labeled with your child's name. Kids
   should be careful about what they choose to bring to camp. OKC staff will
   not be able to be responsible for any personal items.


Thank you and we look forward to a great summer!


Adam Brussow
Director, Club Kinawa
Okemos Public Schools
517-706-5231

subject: 4th-7th Grade Summer Camp Newsletter - Week 1
body:
*Week 1 - Science*
June 17th to June 21st

*What's Happening!*
*Monday*: Hawk Island (Swimming). Bus leaves 12:45 and returns 4:15.
*Wednesday*: OHS Pool Swimming, Bus leaves 1:00 and returns 3:30.
*Thursday*: Impression 5 Presentation 3:00-4:00.
*Friday*: Michigan Science Center. Bus leaves 8:00 and returns 4:15.

*Crew*
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Mrs. Carolina (Program Assistant)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)

*Reminders:*
● Friday is a Field Trip day which means your camper NEEDS to wear their
field trip shirt. (They will receive their shirt this week)
● Please remember to bring your ID with you when you picking up your child.
● Please bring a packed lunch with your child’s name on it that is
completely disposable.
● Bring a water bottle with your child’s name on it everyday.
● Bring a swimsuit and towel the days that we go swimming
● Bring sunscreen/bug spray.

Get ready to take flight!

Adam Brussow
Lead, OKC Summer Camp
517-706-5233

subject: OKC Summer Camp - Week 5, 4th-7th Grade
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families,

Thank you for choosing to join us for Summer Camp this year! We are looking
forward to having a great time!

Please be aware that we will be practicing some new policies and procedures
this summer, including:

*Drop Off / Pick up*
All children need to check in outside the front door for a health
screening. Then you can drop off your child at the exterior door of their
classroom. We are Door #2, conveniently the closest to the front door! When
picking up your child, please check in at the front door and staff will
radio to your child's room to let them exit Door #2.

*Items from home*
Please send:

   - Sunscreen (Spray or face stick preferably so your child can apply
   theirself).
   - Bug Spray.
   - Extra clothes to keep in their bag.
   - Bathing suit & towel on water play days (Tues & Thurs)
   - Hat (we will be outside often)
   - *Water Bottle*
   - *COLD lunch (Microwaves will not be available for use by children or
   staff). We will not be able to make any exceptions.*

*** Children will not be able to bring items from home for play (toys,
devices, etc.) We will not be able to make any exceptions.*

Daily Schedule

*Art Week*
7:00-8:45        Sign in / Free choice
8:45-9:30        Snack/Outside
9:30-11:00      Monday - 3k Walk
                       Tuesday - Marble Art
`                      Wednesday - Foil Relief Art
                       Thursday - Watercolor Resist Art
                       Friday - Spin Art Painting
11:00-11:45    Free Choice
11:45-12:15   Gym
12:15-12:45   Lunch
12:45-1:15     Outside
1:15-2:00       Monday - Salt Coloring
                      Tuesday - Splatter Painting
                      Wednesday - Tie-Dye T-Shirts
                      Thursday - Melted Crayon Art
                      Friday - Tape Art
2:00-2:45       Free Choice (MWF)
                      Water Play (TTH)
2:45-3:30       Gym
3:30-4:00       Snack
4:00-5:00       Free choice
5:00-5:30       Outside
5:30-6:00       D.E.A.R.

*The Staff*
[image: IMG_20200619_132438.jpg][image: IMG_20200619_132539.jpg]
Mr. Brussow

[image: IMG_20200619_132634_01.jpg][image: IMG_20200619_132802_01.jpg]
Ms. Kelsie

Adam Brussow
Director, Club Kinawa
Okemos Public Schools
517-706-4715

subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 9
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families!

Our theme for this week is *Around the World!*

   - We will be going to the OHS Pool *Monday* from *1:00 to 3:30* to swim.
   - The *Wednesda*y field trip is to *Burchfield Park
   <https://pk.ingham.org/parks/burchfield.php>* in Holt from *11:15 to
   3:15*. We will be eating lunch at the park, so please make sure to send
   a disposable bag lunch.
   - *Foods Around the World*
   For our Thursday Activity this week, we are asking families and staff to
   bring in foods from different cultures! We will set up all the foods in the
   commons area and allow kids and staff to have a taste of the
   different foods. We are looking for a mix of savory, snack, and
   dessert foods! **We will need a complete ingredient list for
   the foods brought in for allergy reasons.
   - Please send swimwear, water shoes, and a towel Monday, and Friday
   (Outside Water Play).


*Drop Off / Pick up*

   - Sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up using the time and
   initials.
   - You may enter through door #9, go to the classroom (Room 109) to be
   let in the classroom.
   - Door #9 will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. From 9:00-4:00,
   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.
   - Please have a photo ID with you at pick up.


*Please send:*

   - Sunscreen.
   - Bug Spray.(FYI - Burchfield Park can have more mosquitos than other
   parks we visit)
   - Extra clothes.
   - Water Bottle.
   - Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on water play (Friday) and
   swimming days (Monday).

   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.

Mr. Brussow (Lead)

*Reminders:*

subject: OKC Summer Camp Welcome 4th-7th Grade
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families,

Thank you for choosing to join us for Summer Camp this year! We are looking
forward to having a great time!

Please be aware that we will be practicing some new policies and procedures
this summer, including:

*Drop Off / Pick up*
All children need to check in outside the front door for a health
screening. Then you can drop off your child at the exterior door of their
classroom. We are Door #2, conveniently the closest to the front door! When
picking up your child, please check in at the front door and staff will
radio to your child's room to let them exit Door #2.

*Items from home*

subject: OKC Summer Camp 4th-7th Grade - Week 1
body:
Hello Okemos Kids Club Families,

Thank you for choosing to join us for Summer Camp this year! We are looking
forward to having a great time!

Here is some information for you regarding Summer Camp and this week's
schedule. Our theme this week is Community Service.

*Drop Off / Pick up*

   - Sign your child in and out at drop off/pick up using the time and
   initials.
   - You may enter through door #1, go to the classroom (Room 107) to be
   let in the classroom.
   - Door #1 will be unlocked from 7:15-9:00 & 4:00-6:00. From 9:00-4:00,
   parents will need to be buzzed into the building.
   - Please have a *photo ID* with you at pick up.


*Please send:*
Sunscreen.
Bug Spray.
Extra clothes.
Water Bottle.
Bathing suit, water shoes, and towel on water play (Friday) and swimming
days.
Hat (we will be outside often).
Cold lunch from home *each day*. Microwave ovens will not be available for
children to use.

*Junkyard Wars*
One of our Thursday activities this year for summer camp will be "junkyard
wars" (taking place on July 21st). The kids will be creating
unique/creative structures out of recycled materials and looking for
donations. We'll take just about anything with which the kids can use
safely to build.
Some examples are:
(no glass or aluminum cans)
boxes
paper towel/toilet paper rolls
tissue boxes
other cardboard items
plastic containers (that have been cleaned)
foam
milk jugs
bubble wrap

*Community Service Week Schedule*
7:15-9:00     Sign in / Free choice
9:00-10:00   Snack & Outside
10:00-11:00 Wednesday - Ice Breaker Activities/Free Choice
                    Thursday - Exploratories - Straw Gliders
                    Friday - Exploratories - Rubber Band Painting
11:00-12:00 Free choice (Gym 11:30 T/Th)
12:00-12:30 Lunch
12:30-1:00   Literacy Time
                    Apply Sunscreen/Bug Spray
1:00-3:00    Wednesday - Ice Breaker Activities
                   Thursday - Cleaning up around Edgewood
                   Friday - Water Play (2:30 - 3:15)
3:00-4:00    Snack & Outside
4:00-5:30    Free choice
5:30-6:00    Quiet Free Choice

*Staff*
Mr. Brussow (Lead)
Mr. Khari (Program Assistant)
Ms. Maren (Program Assistant)

*Reminders:*

   - If a child needs prescription medication, parents and doctors must
   sign a district form and provide that form with the medication.
   - Wednesday is a Field Trip day which means your camper NEEDS to wear
   their field trip shirt. They will receive a shirt the second week of camp.
   (Or their first week if not attending next week).
   - All personal belongings should be labeled with your child's name. Kids
   should be careful about what they choose to bring to camp. OKC staff will
   not be able to be responsible for any personal items.


Thank you and we look forward to a great summer!

Adam Brussow
4th-7th Summer Camp Lead
Okemos Public Schools
517-706-5231
